channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Job-hopping Gen Z only stay in each job 1 year and 54% are regularly browsing for their next role—but a report says they’re not disloyal villains
item.description: While Gen Xers and baby boomers stayed in their first jobs for around 3 years, Gen Z are ditching their employers yearly without the promise of bigger...

item.title: The ‘Great Lock-In’ is more than a Gen Z TikTok trend—it’s a rejection of millennials’ ‘soft life’ and taking back power in this economy
item.description: Remember when "hustle culture" was a thing, then generation burnout? That's such a millennial way of looking at things.

item.title: Google’s AI is the ‘worst’ for stealing content, says People CEO
item.description: But Google-owned YouTube could provide a model for media and AI to coexist and thrive, says internet industry pioneer Bill Gross.

item.title: Is there a crypto bubble? Yes, says CEO of $15 billion exchange Kraken
item.description: Arjun Sethi said he’s bullish long term but believes we’re in a short-term hype cycle.

item.title: Charlie Kirk’s murder is the latest violent act to put public-facing leaders on edge
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Nebius crystallizes gains from Microsoft deal with stock and bond offering
I’m 80 and my RMD is $300,000. What am I supposed to do about my huge tax bill?
Here's a JPMorgan cheat sheet on how S&P 500 may react to CPI
Retail investors are their least confident since April tariffs: AAII
August's CPI is this week's most crucial data for stock investors. What to know.
